Assembly Interpreter Engine
The core language processing engine written in C# that powers BitNaughts' in-game programming challenges. Players write assembly-level OP codes which this interpreter steps through instruction-by-instruction.

Architecture:
  • Interpreter.cs â€” Main execution loop; parses and executes OP code instructions sequentially
  • Instruction.cs â€” Data model representing individual assembly instructions (opcode + operands)
  • Variable.cs â€” Register and memory variable management for the virtual machine
  • ColorCoder.cs â€” Syntax highlighting for the in-game terminal; color-codes keywords; registers; and literals
Designed as a Git submodule consumed by bitnaughts.unity; enabling modular development of the language engine independent of the game client.

Serverless Back-End â€” bitnaughts.azurewebsites.net
An Azure Function App written in C# that provides cloud persistence for multiplayer game state. Hosted as a serverless endpoint with two HTTP-triggered functions.

Functions:
  • Ping() â€” Multiplayer state sync via MongoDB; upserts player data keyed by name; returns all other players' state (uses â™– delimiter). Connection secured with TLS 1.2 and TTL indexes for automatic document expiry (expireAfterSeconds: 10).
  • Mainframe() â€” Git-based persistence layer; clones bitnaughts.db repo to temp storage; reads/writes player save files as .txt; then commits and pushes changes back via LibGit2Sharp.
Stack: Azure Functions; MongoDB (CosmosDB-compatible); LibGit2Sharp; Newtonsoft.Json

Language Breakdown: Python (74.7%); HTML (23.5%); Jupyter Notebook (1.8%)

Capabilities:
  • Multi-voice synthesis â€” clone and generate speech in different character voices from short reference clips

  • Configurable voice presets for distinct in-game characters and narrators
